bib.title: The H-3(He3,gamma)Li-6 capture reaction and the structure of Li-6.

free_txt: Corrected By V.Varlamov, V.Mclane
Corrected by V.Varlamov: dates, doi,
lowercase.
Entry deleted because of duplication with A1081.
The capture reaction H-3(He3,g)Li-6 has been  studied
for  He-3  bombarding  energies  from  9  to 26 MeV.
Transitions to the ground  and  first  four  excited
states   in   Li-6  are  observed.  The  90  degrees
differential cross  section  for  the  ground  state
transition decreases smoothly from 9 to 26 MeV.  The
90 degrees differential cross section for the  first
excited  state  transition  shows  a  broad  maximum
centered  at  E(He-3)=20.6(0.4)  MeV  indicating   a
possible resonance in Li-6 at Ex=26.2(0.4) MeV.  The
excitation function for the transition to the  third
excited state also shows a broad maximum centered at
Ex=26.6(0.4) MeV.  The excitation functions for  the
transitions   to  the  second  (t=1.0+)  and  fourth
(t=1.2+) excited states have also been measured. The
former does  not show any resonance structure, while
the  latter  shows  a  broad  maximum  indicating  a
possible  resonance  in  Li-6  at  Ex=26.7(0.4) MeV.
These  results   are   compared   with   theoretical
predictions.
